channel.title: tastytrade: Options Jive
channel.description: If you want to trade like a tastytrader, you have to learn how to talk like a tastytrader. Sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss popular trading topics that give you an edge when opening, closing and managing your trades.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Learn to talk the talk - sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss trading topics of the day.
channel.itunes:author: tastytrade
channel.itunes:summary: If you want to trade like a tastytrader, you have to learn how to talk like a tastytrader. Sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss popular trading topics that give you an edge when opening, closing and managing your trades.
channel.googleplay:author: tastytrade, Inc.

item.title: Insurance Is Not Cheap
item.description: Traders have started to worry about the potential long-term bear market and the right strategy to hedge against their portfolios. Instead of selling calls which provides limited protections, traders look for more aggressive hedging strategies, such as buying puts. Is this a good idea?Join Tom and Tony as they discuss this strategy.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Traders have started to worry about the potential long-term bear market and the right strategy to hedge against their portfolios. Instead of selling calls which provides limited protections, traders look for more aggressive hedging strategies, suc...

Instead of selling calls which provides limited protections, traders look for more aggressive hedging strategies, such as buying puts. Is this a good idea?Join Tom and Tony as they discuss this strategy.

item.title: Profits Per Credit
item.description: tastytrade research often focuses on the percentage of winning trades. But how much winning do those winners actually do? Today, Tom and Tony dive into the data to see just how much of the initial credit tastytraders get to take home.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade

item.title: Research Corner
item.description: Get ready for this week's Research Corner! Anton joins Tom and Tony with research-driven statistics including: correlations, expected moves, implied volatility overstatement, historical volatilities, pairs trades expected moves, and price ranks.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Get ready for this week's Research Corner! Anton joins Tom and Tony with research-driven statistics including: correlations, expected moves, implied volatility overstatement, historical volatilities, pairs trades expected moves, and price ranks.
item.content:encoded: Get ready for this week's Research Corner! Anton joins Tom and Tony with research-driven statistics including: correlations, expected moves, implied volatility overstatement, historical volatilities, pairs trades expected moves, and price ranks.

item.title: VIX Term Structure
item.description: The Term Structure of VIX measures traders’ perceptions of 30-day volatility X days in the future. The term structure for indices such as SPX is usually upward sloping, which is called contango. But sometimes, we find the opposite scenario with downward sloping. Join Tom and Tony as they discuss contango and backwardation and how often we have seen backwardation this year so far?
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle:
The Term Structure of VIX measures traders’ perceptions of 30-day volatility X days in the future.
The term structure for indices such as SPX is usually upward sloping, which is called contango. But sometimes, we find the opposite scenario with d...
item.content:encoded: The Term Structure of VIX measures traders’ perceptions of 30-day volatility X days in the future. The term structure for indices such as SPX is usually upward sloping, which is called contango. But sometimes, we find the opposite scenario with downward sloping. Join Tom and Tony as they discuss contango and backwardation and how often we have seen backwardation this year so far?

item.title: How Much of BPR is at Risk
item.description: The BPR for a short option trade is how much capital the brokerage reserves to cover potential losses. But how often does it really come to that? Today, Tony and Nick dive into the data to see just how often we lose how much of the BPR, contrasting a range of underlying's and strategies.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade

Today, Tony and Nick dive into the data to see just how often we lose how much of the BPR, contrasting a range of underlying's and strategies.

item.title: Short VXX
item.description: Due to the unique nature of the VXX, its price has been in a downtrend over 80% of the time. So would selling the VXX since its inception have been the greatest short of all time?Join Tom and Tony as they discuss whether shorting VXX is a bulletproof trading idea.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade

item.title: Volatility Effects: Strikes and Deltas
item.description: The level of volatility is perhaps the most important feature of the market to tastytraders. Adapting our trading mechanics to different volatility environments is a key step to staying active in the market and capitalizing on opportunities to sell premium. Today, Tom and Tony look at the data on how the relationship between strikes and deltas changes as volatility increases.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: The level of volatility is perhaps the most important feature of the market to tastytraders. Adapting our trading mechanics to different volatility environments is a key step to staying active in the market and capitalizing on opportunities to sel...
item.content:encoded: The level of volatility is perhaps the most important feature of the market to tastytraders. Adapting our trading mechanics to different volatility environments is a key step to staying active in the market and capitalizing on opportunities to sell premium. Today, Tom and Tony look at the data on how the relationship between strikes and deltas changes as volatility increases.

item.title: A Case Study Of BPR
item.description: The BPR (Buying Power Requirement) is priced based on the position’s risk level. The higher the risk, the higher the BPR.Many factors can impact a position’s BPR, so today, let’s look at a case study of how the BPR of a naked put changes in both up and down markets. Join Tom and Tony as they analyze an interesting case study.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade

item.content:encoded: The BPR (Buying Power Requirement) is priced based on the position’s risk level. The higher the risk, the higher the BPR.Many factors can impact a position’s BPR, so today, let’s look at a case study of how the BPR of a naked put changes in both up and down markets. Join Tom and Tony as they analyze an interesting case study.

item.title: Reading IVR: Equities vs. ETFs
item.description: Selling premium when IVR is high is the cornerstone of tasty mechanics. But what is "high" when it comes to IVR? Today, Tom and Tony check the data to see what qualifies as high IVR and how it differs for different classes of underlying.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Selling premium when IVR is high is the cornerstone of tasty mechanics. But what is "high" when it comes to IVR? Today, Tom and Tony check the data to see what qualifies as high IVR and how it differs for different classes of underlying.

item.title: Key Components of BPR
item.description: The BPR (buying power requirement) is crucial to option traders because it is part of the calculation to get potential ROC.The option’s BPR calculation, especially for naked positions, is more complex than the stocks, but understanding the key components is sufficient for traders to measure the risks.Join Tom and Tony as they discuss the key components of a naked position’s BPR and why understanding it is important.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: The BPR (buying power requirement) is crucial to option traders because it is part of the calculation to get potential ROC.The option’s BPR calculation, especially for naked positions, is more complex than the stocks, but understanding the key com...
item.content:encoded: The BPR (buying power requirement) is crucial to option traders because it is part of the calculation to get potential ROC.The option’s BPR calculation, especially for naked positions, is more complex than the stocks, but understanding the key components is sufficient for traders to measure the risks.Join Tom and Tony as they discuss the key components of a naked position’s BPR and why understanding it is important.

item.title: The Lifecycle of Earnings Volatility
item.description:
Increased volatility preceding earnings announcements can provide tastytraders with additional opportunities to sell premium, but how far before earnings does volatility become elevated and how reliably does volatility come back down after earnings? 

Today, Tom and Tony dive into the data to get to explore these questions and see how we can incorporate these lessons into our earnings strategies.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Increased volatility preceding earnings announcements can provide tastytraders with additional opportunities to sell premium, but how far before earnings does volatility become elevated and how reliably does volatility come back down after earning...
